title: The Ergex Regular Expression Engine
description:
Ergex is a regular expression engine written in Rust. It has some unusual features:

  • A push architecture (so you can look for matches in streaming or distributed data)
  • Simultaneous matching of arbitrarily many expressions
  • No allocations during matching time
  • Always linear performance
  • A push-oriented implementation of Aho-Corasick
  • An interesting ShrinkSet data structure

It is nowhere close to ready for prime time, but some stuff has come up in my personal life that means I won‚Äôt be able to dedicate much time to it for the foreseeable future (everything‚Äôs fine, thank you), and rather than let it languish, I put it out there. It‚Äôs got a fairly comprehensive test suite and works pretty well for the state it‚Äôs in.

title: Looking for an old talk about "meta"
description:
A while back I watched a talk about ‚Äúmeta‚Äù on Youtube but I cannot find it now (searching ‚Äúmeta‚Äù on Google just gives a lot of useless results about ‚ÄúMeta‚Äù the company). That talk is from early 2000s, but I believe it‚Äôs very famous, so chances are that you guys have watched it as well. Most notably, it‚Äôs in ‚Äúsimple English‚Äù, i.e. every single word in that talk consists of ~3 syllables or fewer. Also, the presenter defined ‚Äúmeta‚Äù as something like ‚Äútreating verbs as nouns‚Äù.

That‚Äôs everything I can remember now. Do you know the name of that talk?

description: Erlang/OTP have several profiling tools which are available out of the box - the fprof is one of them. The fprof ¬© ‚Äî A Time Profiling Tool using trace to file for minimal runtime performance impact ‚Äî In other words, this tool provides a lot of useful information in readable format for quick diagnosis of performance issues.
